content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 15 Apr 2019When looking to buy into S&P 500, is it wise for me to buy SPDR S&P500 US$ (S27:SGX)?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Nicholes Wong, Diploma in Business Management at Nanyang PolytechnicLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 07 Jun 2019You should get the VUSD or CSPX on the london stock exchange instead. They reduce the US withholding tax from 30% to 15%.2 comments0

Question Poster17 Apr 2019Thank you for your reply. The prices between VUSD & CSPX are so great. Why is this so?Nicholes Wong17 Apr 2019Im not too sure as that are the prices that the ETF company sets based on their NAV and other than cheaper ETFs you can buy more, there shouldnt be any important difference. The performance and cost are the more important factors.
